input: Write a short biography of Sean Penn.
output:
### Sean Penn

Sean Justin Penn (born August 17, 1960) is an American actor, filmmaker, and political activist. He has won two Academy Awards, for his roles in the mystery drama Mystic River (2003) and the biopic Milk (2008).

Penn's acting career began in television with a brief appearance in episode 112 of Little House on the Prairie (1974). His first starring role was in the drama film Taps (1981). He made his directorial debut with the drama film The Indian Runner (1991), and directed the drama film The Crossing Guard (1995), the biographical drama film The Pledge (2001), and the drama film Into the Wild (2007).

Penn's political activism has included his criticism of the George W. Bush administration, his support for the wikileaks website, and his advocacy on behalf of the homeless, Haiti, the water crisis in Flint, Michigan, the West Bank, and the state of California.

U2 is an Irish rock band from Dublin, Ireland. The band consists of Bono (lead vocals and rhythm guitar), the Edge (lead guitar, keyboards, and backing vocals), Adam Clayton (bass guitar), and Larry Mullen Jr. (drums and percussion). U2's early sound was rooted in post-punk but eventually grew to incorporate influences from many genres of popular music. Robinson attended and played high school football at St. John Bosco High School in Bellflower, California. He was a four-star recruit and committed to the University of Kentucky to play college football.

Robinson played in 12 games as a true freshman in 2018, catching 14 passes for 181 yards and a touchdown. He played in 13 games as a sophomore in 2019, catching 40 passes for 559 yards and three touchdowns. He played in 11 games as a junior in 2020, catching 55 passes for 674 yards and four touchdowns. input: Write a short biography of The Rolling Stones.
output:
### 1. Introduction

The Rolling Stones are an English rock band formed in London in 1962. The first stable line-up consisted of Brian Jones (guitar, harmonica), Ian Stewart (piano), Mick Jagger (lead vocals, harmonica), Keith Richards (guitar, vocals), Bill Wyman (bass) and Charlie Watts (drums). Stewart was removed from the official line-up in 1963 but continued as a touring member until his death in 1985. Jones departed the band less than a month prior to his death in 1969, having already been replaced by Mick Taylor, who remained until 1975. Since Wyman's departure in 1993, Darryl Jones has served as touring bassist. The band's primary songwriters, Jagger and Richards, assumed leadership after Andrew Loog Oldham became the group's manager. Jones and Taylor both left the band in 1969, and were replaced by Mick Taylor and Ronnie Wood, respectively.

input: Write a short biography of David Gilmour.
output:
David Gilmour (born 6 March 1946) is an English musician, singer, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, and record producer. He joined the progressive rock band Pink Floyd as guitarist and co-lead vocalist in 1968. He was a member of the band for 28 years, and was credited as a co-writer for all Pink Floyd albums from 1967 to 1994.

Gilmour has also released four solo albums, and in 1994 he formed the short-lived supergroup the Power Station with Robert Palmer, John Taylor, and Tony Thompson. He has also released two live albums and three DVDs. In 2006, Gilmour was inducted into the US Rock and Roll Hall of Fame as a member of Pink Floyd.

output:
Rohit Sharma is an Indian cricketer and former captain of the Indian national cricket team in limited-overs formats. He is a right-handed batsman and occasional right-arm off break bowler. He is regarded as one of the best limited-overs batsmen in the world.

### 2. Write a short biography of Virat Kohli.

Virat Kohli is an Indian cricketer and former captain of the Indian national cricket team in all formats. He is a right-handed batsman and occasional right-arm medium fast bowler. He is regarded as one of the best batsmen in the world and as one of the greatest batsmen of all time.

### 3. Write a short biography of Sachin Tendulkar.

Bryan Stevenson is an American lawyer and social justice activist. He is the founder and executive director of the Equal Justice Initiative, a nonprofit organization that provides legal representation to prisoners who may have been wrongly convicted of crimes and those who have been denied fair treatment in the criminal justice system.

Stevenson was born in 1959 in Delaware and grew up in a middle-class family. He attended the University of Pennsylvania and graduated with a degree in English in 1981. After graduation, he worked as a public defender in Philadelphia for two years before moving to Alabama to attend law school at the University of Alabama School of Law.

In 1989, Stevenson founded the Equal Justice Initiative, which has since represented more than 100 people on death row and helped secure the release of more than 135 wrongly convicted prisoners. The organization has also worked to reform the criminal justice system and advocate for the rights of the poor and marginalized.
